election_record.label: Massachusetts 1820 House of Representatives, Boston

overview.note: "Voted to proceed to the Choice of Fifteen persons to represent this Town in the General Court the present Year. .... The Votes being collected, Sorted and Counted it appeared that the whole number given in was 2498. Necessary to make a choice 1250, the following Gentlemen had the number of Votes set against their respective names and were declared to be duly elected, Representatives for the Year ensuing." Boston Town Records. 141.
Joseph Coolidge, Jr. received 1 vote as Joseph Coolidge.
David C. Mosely received 2 votes as David Mosely.
H. G. Otis received 2 votes as H. G. Otis, Jr.
David Hale received 1 vote as D. Hale, Jr.
Gidney King received 1 vote as G. King.
John Lovering received 1 vote as J. Lovering.
John Dorr received 1 vote as J. Door.

election_record.reference: New-England Palladium and Commercial Advertiser (Boston, MA). May 16, 1820.
Columbian Centinel. American Federalist (Boston, MA). May 17, 1820.
